content:
I’m a PhD student at the Institute of Computational Linguistics working on my SNSF funded project Natural Language Processing for Low-Resource Language Variations ( LORELAI).
I’m very much fascinated by the variations of languages and the challenges they pose for NLP.
summary:

title: Noëmi Aepli

summary: data set for developing NLP applications for Swiss German & baseline for dialect identification
title: A Resource for Natural Language Processing of Swiss German Dialects

summary: an approach to developing resources for a low-resource language, taking advantage of closely related languages
title: Part-of-Speech Tag Disambiguation by Cross-Linguistic Majority Vote

summary: Universal Dependency Parsing for Swiss German
title: Swiss German UD
